Wagner Labor ArchiveElmer Holmes Bobst Library70 Washington Square South2nd FloorNew York, NY 10012(212) 998-2596special.collections@nyu.eduThis finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2022-02-01T20:25:06Description written in EnglishDescribing Archives: A Content Standard Materials are in English.
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Randy Cunningham Collection on the New American Movement
Cunningham, Randy, (Political Activist)
Cunningham, Randy, (Political Activist)
TAM.806
.75 linear feet in 1 manuscript box and 1 half manuscript box
1977-1981 Randy Cunningham is a Cleveland-based activist and writer. He is a founding member of the Cuyahoga County Progressive Caucus. Cunningham was the Chair of New American Movement's Urban and Community Commission during the late-1970s and early-1980s, working on campaigns that focused on rent control in Dayton Ohio. As a member of the Mad River (Dayton) chapter he helped organize workshops and conventions on urban issues. The Randy Cunningham Collection on the New American Movement (dated 1977-1981) consists of materials collected by Cunningham during his time with the socialist organization the New American Movement (NAM) before it merged with the Democratic Socialist Organizing Committee (DSOC) to form Democratic Socialists of America (DSA). Materials include drafts of NAM's The Primitive Socialist City Project, materials from the Baltimore Urban Organizing Conference, Urban and Community Commission correspondence, and political education and campaign materials from Baltimore, Dayton, and Pittsburgh. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.
Scope and Contents
The Randy Cunningham Collection on the New American Movement (dated 1977-1981) consists of materials collected by Cunningham during his time with the socialist organization the New American Movement (NAM) before it merged with the Democratic Socialist Organizing Committee (DSOC) to form Democratic Socialists of America (DSA). Materials include drafts of NAM's The Primitive Socialist City Project, materials from the Baltimore Urban Organizing Conference, Urban and Community Commission correspondence, and political education and campaign materials from Baltimore, Dayton, and Pittsburgh.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Conditions Governing Use
This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Randy Cunningham in January 2022; the accession number associated with this gift is 2022.007.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Randy Cunningham Collection on the New American Movement; TAM 806; box number; folder number or item identifier; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Processing Information
At the time of accessioning materials were rehoused in archival boxes, and described on the collection level with a folder-level inventory.
Biographical Note
Randy Cunningham is a Cleveland-based activist and writer. He is a founding member of the Cuyahoga County Progressive Caucus. Cunningham was the Chair of New American Movement's Urban and Community Commission during the late-1970s and early-1980s, working on campaigns that focused on rent control in Dayton Ohio. As a member of the Mad River (Dayton) chapter he helped organize workshops and conventions on urban issues.
